# stringRepresentation

**Instance Property**

Returns a formatted string with the unpremultiplied color and alpha components of the color.

## Declaration

```swift
var stringRepresentation: String { get }
```

## Discussion

The string representation always has four components: red, green, blue, and alpha.

Some example string representations of colors:



To create a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColor] instance from a string representation, use the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColor/init(string:)] method.

If the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColor] was initialized with a `CGColor` in a non-RGB `CGColorSpace` then it will be converted to sRGB to get the red, green, and blue components.

This property is not KVO-safe because it returns a new `NSString` instance each time. The value of the `NSString` will be the same each time it is called.

## Getting Color Components

- **colorSpace**: Returns the `CGColorSpace` associated with the color
- **components**: Return a pointer to an array of `CGFloat` values including alpha.
- **numberOfComponents**: Returns the color components of the color including alpha.
- **red**: Returns the unpremultiplied red component of the color.
- **green**: Returns the unpremultiplied green component of the color.
- **blue**: Returns the unpremultiplied blue component of the color.
- **alpha**: Returns the alpha value of the color.
